decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years, beginning with the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials to be used for the external surfaces of the building/extension hereby approved shall be those specified in the approved drawing or planning application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 3 - The roof of the extension or flat roofed areas hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden, sitting out area or for any other purpose of a similar nature without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The proposed rear extension is acceptable with regard to impact on the amenities of neighbouring occupiers and impact on the character and appearance of the dwellinghouse. The proposal accords with the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.
Adopted Merton Unitary Development Plan (October 2003): 
BE. 15 (New Buildings and Extensions; Daylight, Sunlight, Privacy, Visual Intrusion and Noise)
BE. 16 (Urban Design)
BE. 22 (Design of New Development)
BE. 23 (Alterations and Extensions to Buildings)
description: ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION
